segments.text: What a scene unfolds in this little kitchen, a quiet chaos in broad daylight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying her dishes, seemingly in her own world, not aware of the impending doom.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water gushes over the sink; it’s remarkable how she can just ignore it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there’s the boy, climbing far too high on that unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m almost yelling internally at him to stop, to get down safely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so determined to reach that cookie jar; it’s both admirable and reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the little girl, waiting so patiently with that hopeful palm held up, it’s all too sweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Still, I can’t ignore the mess they’re creating and the risk they’re taking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to intervene, to shout a warning, but I remain an unseen spectator.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast of the well-kept yard outside with the turmoil inside is quite jarring.
segments.speaker: PAR
